author: _elroy
body:
Treasuries/Bonds are exploding - People are looking for a safe haven in the wake of the US dollar falling (bad for stocks).

Gold is starting to fall - People are looking to liquidate to cover costs/shorts and move their money to a safer vessel, like Treasuries (bad for stocks)

Stocks are starting to move rapidly downward, momentum picking up and the MA lines are showing the beginning of a longer sell off - (really bad for stocks)

EXPECT: End of day bull run for a massive margin calls and short coverings. Expect at least 5% jump

EXPECT: Banks are no longer allowing buy backs for a lot of companies. Expect companies and banks to liquidate falling shares to cover short term liquidity needs 

EDIT: EXPECT: More unscheduled Repos that may temporarily pump the market - This means buy longer dated puts. 3 weeks minimum. 2-3 standard deviations OTM **maximum**.

EXPECT: A low of today near 245, likely around 3PM. 

EXPECT: A lot of sideways movement this week in the downward direction, likely will hurt you with IV but wont be an IV killer

EXPECT: Friday to have a massive run up and a gap down Monday morning.

EXPECT: Approx 10-25 thousand infections in the US, if testing permits. Actual values will likely be closer to 30-40 thousand suspected cases. 

EXPECT: Major metropolitan areas to shut down all nonessential businesses. 


# GOOD LUCK, THIS HAS BEEN YOUR NOON DD. TO ALL THE GAY BULLS THAT FOLLOW ME AROUND TRYING TO FIND A "GOTCHA" THE CLAIMS POSTED HERE ARE CURRENT TO THE MARKET AS OF 12:04PM EST. GET REKT. BE SAFE.

author: Hsrock
body:
I don't understand why people think this is the bottom when:

* college kids are being sent home / moving out across the US as their spring breaks end
* elementary / middle / high school kids are being sent home for at least 2-4 weeks
* large gatherings of 250-500+ people are being cancelled or prohibited for the next 4+ weeks both at local/state level (e.g. Maryland, NY) and at the organizer level (e.g. Google Next / IO will be digital, SXSW is completely cancelled)
* hospitals are only starting to feel the patient burden, but are definitely feeling the strain on the medical system with lack of tests and too many patients
* companies are just STARTING to implement remote work policies
* nationwide virus testing is still \~10k/day due to testing shortages and strict requirements, contrary to what Pence promised a week ago

Yes, today we bounced, as expected after a historic red week, but unless Trump whips a miracle out of his ass, the truth will come to light as soon as donated test kits from Jack Ma (Alibaba) / Gates Foundation are distributed & more testimonies from our healthcare systems go ballistic. 

We're still in the "shock" phase of things happening, we haven't started feeling the pain in America yet...

author: catsmeow492
body:
200 is a standard longterm trend indicator.  If the market is above it, it's probably bullish. If it's below it, it's probably bearish.  Some people do short/long MA/EMA crossovers but I feel like it's kind of pointless.  Short MAs are pretty much going to be on candle anyway.

RSI is pretty simple on longer windows, anytime it's below 40 it's oversold, anytime it's below 40 with other bearish indicators it's a full blown selloff. On shorter windows it's more used to pick entry positions.  For example, this monday/tuesday I'm going to be using it to pick my short/put entry.  When it's overbought on the 1h window I'll either buy a put or go short.

author: poopdeloop
body:
I’d say a month to be safe. 

I think right now we are not testing accurately, and so it will be revealed the sheer penetration of the virus in the US. I think it is not likely, but not impossible, we reach rates of 5-10K a day diagnosed. 

There are quarantines but they are still mostly recommended and not severe enough. In a perfect world we’d lock down NY, CA, WA, MA, FL with some sort of nat guard presence.

We just haven’t gotten tests out fast enough. Until tests are widely available, we cannot recover. That is step 1.

author: ridenourt
body:
I think you are right about a snap back rally, however this is the start of the downtrend and we just passed the peak. the valuation on a lot of stocks was just way to high and the market was looking for a sell off.

This is all a bull trap though. we push higher Monday -Tuesday and possibly even into late Wednesday, however it's going to get bad when individual states start testing soon in NY, CA, WA, MA, FL, and OR. We are finally going to see how far this virus has really spread and it's not good.

Some interesting notes from the WHO report from China. 3.4% mortality rate which is higher than I thought. The 15% of people who need oxygen for 3-6 weeks and the 5% of people who need a ventilator which can be found on page 32. Pneumonia is closer to 30% and when they say mild it means the worst flu of your life. The US healthcare system will get completely shocked and if we start seeing rising numbers like South Korea or Italy there will be some serious pain. In addition other places like South America, Central America, and Africa could see death rates as high as 10-15% due to extremely poor health care.

Next the supply chain right now is completely screwed. Los Angeles saw a drop off 25% shipping in February which the last two weeks it was a reduction of almost 36%. In march they believe it could be a yoy drop of 40 % which is catastrophic. Any rally here would make a good short just buy Puts out a few months. I don't want to get into all the implications of if widget C isn't produced, but widget A, B, and D are here but make your own assumptions.

In addition I have traded for a long time and one thing I know is the market hates uncertainty. Supply chain, virus, and panic is not a model that can be priced in. I don't see any of these factors being settled any time soon.

author: 50Asperger_60Dumb
body:
Im a "fundamental, valuation , value ish (like growth if the profitability is taken care) , quality " investor. 

but  been practising some TA on my fun gambling account, it doesnt tell anything about the future IMO, but it "tells" about current state. I time some of my retarded plays by eyeballing charts 200&50 MA , "trading ranges & trends" MACD & RSI . 

And its been working. Ofcourse I have a "fundamental opinion" which goes first, also I look a lot bond yields & currencies for confirmation bias, because I believe those markets are less speculative. And when looking charts bigger time frame over smaller, ie. dont fight against 1d chart, MA, "ranges" , MACD or RSI on 1h chart. Dont fight 1min Chart against 5 min chart etc. 

But im a retard, but its been helping me in timing entries & exits I believe.
